fields.description:
When a PR is sent from a fork to the original repo and on the original repo the "links" is required, when I try to merge the PR on the original repo using "Fast-forward" merge-strategy, I get an error in Chrome's Console output, instead of telling me that it's requiring an issue key

How to Replicate

# Create a repo R1 with content (for example with a README file) with user U1 under team T
# Enforce requiring issue keys in commit messages (underneath Settings / Links) on R1
# Invite user U2 to team T
# User U2 forks repo R1 to repo R2
# User U2 pushes a commit to his/her own fork (R2) without an issue key
# User U2 send a PR back to the main repo (R1)
# User U1 tries to merge PR with Fast-forward from U2/R2
# It's going to fail, but can be merged with "Merge commit" strategy

!2722979732-errormessage.png|thumbnail!

Issues:

# I'm not supposed to merge it with "Merge commit" strategy as it should require an issue link
# I'm not supposed to be able to send this PR from fork to the original repo as it doesn't have issue link
# When we try to merge it with "Fast-Forward" strategy, instead of mentioning "Something went wrong", we should mention "Issue key is required"
fields.summary: In PR, the error message is not correctly mentioned

fields.description:
By clicking on the Author icon in the Commits page it shows the following popup (the Author icon is a question mark):

bq. Unmapped user\\
This user is not recognised in Bitbucket.\\
Firstname Lastname <email_address>\\
Create an alias in your repository administration.


I've created an alias by clicking the link "Create an alias in your repository administration" and nothing was changes, still question mark and "Unmapped user" popup.

Then I suspected that the Alias field might be improperly filled automatically with an invalid value. I changed it from Firstname Lastname <email_address> to only email_address and the issue was gone.
fields.summary: By clicking "Create an alias in your repository administration" the Alias is auto-filled with an invalid value

fields.description: Looking at a large diff if you click around or highlight the names of the files they start to disappear. Refreshing resets the files back to normal. I could not reproduce for smaller diffs.
fields.summary: Files disappear from diff list when clicking near files or highlighting file names

fields.description:
After you create a new branch you are taken to a confirmation page that says "Checkout your branch."

There is a button "Checkout in SourceTree"

and below there is some text formatted as code, a command line code for fetching and checking out the new branch.

{{git fetch && git checkout ABC123-branch-description-summary}}

This line is helpful, but if you run it you will fetch every branch in the repo. This is not necessarily desired.

Why not this?

{{git fetch origin ABC123-branch-description-summary && git checkout ABC123-branch-description-summary}}
fields.summary: Checkout Your Branch Screen

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce it:

* Visit Pull requests dashboard https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/pullrequests
* Select Teams which correctly goes to https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/pullrequests?section=teams
* Then select a custom team e.g. https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/pullrequests/teams?section=teams&team=modomoto in my case
* Finally select "All Teams" which incorrectly maps to https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/pullrequests/teams?section=teams&team=

This invalid page is reached via the UI.
fields.summary: Invalid Pull Request Index URL

fields.description:
We're no longer able to search Pull Requests by ID, the search is only looking and plain text.

Expected Results:\\
When you enter the Pull requests search, you should be able to type in a pull request ID. The results should be the Pull Request that matches the ID.

Actual Results:\\
When you enter the Pull Requests search, and you enter a pull request ID. The results do not find the pull request as the search is only looking at plain text within the pull request description.

Workaround:\\
Disable "New pull request list experience"\\
Click your Avatar > Select Bitbucket Labs > Uncheck "New pull request list experience"
fields.summary: Unable to search Pull Request ID

fields.description:
Hello,

Recently (last week) I noticed that the reviewed name is no longer in first position on a pull request.

So that, it is difficult for a reviewer to list all the pull requests he reviewed.\\
This is very inconvenient :-(

Thank you for your help
fields.summary: Pull requests reviewers not longers sorted with authenticated user first

fields.description: Delete this.
fields.summary: ignore this

fields.description:
During pipelines deploy I get an error "Configuration error". But when I paste my config in the validator it says it's correct. My config has been working till today.

My project is bitbucket.org/inventis/drugmand.

fields.description:
When adding a code block in the new comment editor using 3 backticks (```), a drop down to choose the programming language appears.

It would really helpful to set that the default value of that dropdown to the language set for the repository.

It is quite normal, I would say, that comments on PR for a repo will most likely include code snippets in the same language as that of the repo.

The code, bitbucket.org suggested my to include in the title is

e2d866262768453bb1854c8f90d5888f

fields.description:
Hello again!

Author and maintainer of the [Refined Bitbucket|https://github.com/refined-bitbucket/refined-bitbucket] browser extension here.

One of the features of the extension uses the property {{size}} from the response of the  {{/2.0/repositories/{team}/{repo}/refs/commits}} endpoint. Recently I noticed the feature stopped working, and turns out it's because the property is no longer returned.

I reported a very similar issue some time ago and thankfully you guys fixed it, referencing it here in case it can be useful: BCLOUD-16993

So again, I was wondering if this was a mistake or intentional change?
fields.summary: Property `size` missing in `/2.0/repositories/{team}/{repo}/refs/commits` API response

fields.description:
it would be nice if instead of second git repo for the wiki, it would instead use as file/directory inside of the main repo itself to create the wiki from.

For example, if i had a docs/wiki.md file in my main repo the wiki feature would use this instead of a second repo specifically for the repo...

I think this would help with having a single repo for docs and code. They way its setup right now i can see  how the two repos (main repo,wiki repo) can get out of sync.

i can see situation where having two repos would be usefully, but it would be nice to have the options.
fields.summary: bitbucket wiki

fields.description:
The comments in a Pull Request have this "Like" button. It would be nice to have a "Dislike" button also. Perhaps then it should be called differently, same as what Quora or StackOverflow has.

Thank you.

Hi.

Today noticed some "master" repository in a list of my private repos.\\

https://www.dropbox.com/s/645zijb1xv5aa41/Screenshot%202019-02-08%2017.29.39.png?dl=0

fields.description:
When you try to run a custom Pipeline on a Commit's page, or on a Branch, the list of custom Pipelines you can choose from is limited to 50.

If a user has more than 50 custom Pipelines in their .yml file, they will not be able to view all of them in that list.
fields.summary: The list of custom Pipelines displayed on the UI is limited to 50

fields.description:
Hi,

In our team, we use bitbucket pipeline for CI integration, test, build image, push to registry and deploy manually. The thing is that we could only see Test tab and result when 1 or more test failed. I knew it's a design choice you've made but it would be great for us to use this report as a proof to communicate to external partners before deploying a specific branch / version.

It could be great to have an option like the trigger manual option in the bitbucket pipeline file.

Thanks
fields.summary: Pipeline: View Test report whatever tests passes or failed

fields.description:
Currently, we have way, using environment variable BITBUCKET_COMMIT and git cli, to retrieve the message of the commit which have triggered the build. It useful for some conditional step execution.

But I can't think of a way to retrieve the messages of all the commits which are deployed to an environnment.

Use case : I deploy to a test environment, and sometimes, I need to wipe the database. I can do that with a key word in the commit message, but what if this is not the triggering commit's message which contains the keycord, but its parent... which is deployed as well but didn't trigger the build ?
fields.summary: Endpoint to get all the commits which have been deployed

fields.description:
Unable to view groups to add in my repository.

I used to be able to add user groups to access my repositories till a couple of weeks back . this feature suddenly seems to have stopped working.
fields.summary: Unable to add user groups to repositories.

fields.description:
Roughly 1-2 months ago this behaviour just appeared, roughly during the same times as the something like "we will no longer accept TLS" -prompt appeared.

I am worried this creates a security issues, since naturally one becomes inclined to copy paste the password so one can enter it fast with each push. Screen capture. Overlookers.

Generally I am surprised at the amount of times Open SSH seems to communicate with BitBuckets auth-layer, but that aside,

QUESTION: can this behaviour be fixed, so I am not prompted with OpenSSH prompts multiple times before being able to push or pull?

Is this related?

https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/SourceTree-keeps-asking-to-authenticate-again-over-and-over/qaq-p/208965
fields.summary: Pushes and pulls to git require multiple (3 - 5) entries of password to succeed (5 with LFS)

fields.description:
If I create a pipeline which uses a private Docker image, but I provide incorrect authentication to retrieve it, then my step will hang indefinitely (until it times out).

Example YAML:

{code}
#!yaml

image:
  name: phodder/private-image
  username: phodder
  password: wrongpassword
pipelines:
  default:
    - step:
        script:
          - echo "Hello world"
{code}

The first step will never leave the 'Pulling Images' state.
fields.summary: Pipelines build hangs if invalid auth given for build image.

fields.description:
I am trying to use a public docker image in a pipeline. Its size is only 500M but the pipeline stuck at the pulling images step for 20+ minutes and eventually times out. There is no log on the web interface.  Can someone help me understand which part went wrong?

{code}
  - step:
      name: Test end-to-end via nightwatch
      image: tjlian616/nightwatch_chrome
      caches:
        - node
      script:
        - npm install
        - npm run nightwatchCI
{code}
fields.summary: pulling docker image for 20+ minutes in pipeline

My company is changing from Google to Office365 email.  It would be preferable to allow users for our domain to use Off365 as the Oauth provider as the email moves from Google to MS Office365.  Should be fairly easy as well.  Thanks.

fields.description: I'm not sure if this issue is with BitBucket or with AWS, but if I tag a build (git tag) and push that to BitBucket then a webhook is triggered to AWS CodeBuild. But the issue is that I'm calling git tag from the build running in CodeBuild, so it will re-trigger from itself over and over again.

Layout of header seems to be a bit broken

fields.description:
When a Pull Request is created, would not like to include newer commits that are committed after it is created. Would it be possible to automatically tag the PR to a particular commit?

This is different from Cherry-Pick.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Tag Pull Request for specific commits

fields.description:
We are letting users install our app for their teams following the guide here: https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/bitbucket/install-an-app-from-your-site/

We already display a list of all Bitbucket Teams the user has access to on our page and let them select for which team they would like install the app when clicking on the "Connect to Bitbucket" button. Once the user gets to https://bitbucket.org/site/addons/authorize?descriptor_uri=APP_DESCRIPTOR_URL there is a dropdown where the user needs to select the team again.

Would it be possible to add a parameter to that url that will pre select the desired team in that dropdown?
fields.summary: Allow apps to pass team id to pre select Team in authorize dropdown

fields.description: It would be nice to refresh the page each time when Pull Requests option (from left panel) is tapped even if the current page is for Pull Requests.

fields.description:
Dear Engineers,

It would be a useful feature if e.g. an X amount of build minutes or LFS storage would be used, either it would trigger an email or even suspend the account until manual action is taken.
fields.summary: Being able to create alerts or limits for dynamic billing (Pipelines or LFS)

fields.description:
When running a pipeline with a {{step:}} that has  an empty definition, pipelines will (correctly) error.

Pipelines suggests using the validator to vaildate the yml, but the validator finds no issues with it.

Ideally the validator would catch this.

{code}
The 'provision-prod-east' section in your bitbucket-pipelines.yml file is missing a 'step'.

Please add the missing 'step' to fix the error.
{code}
fields.summary: Pipelines yml validator should be more strict

fields.description:
We use emojis in the Pull Request titles for marking different state/severity of the issue.

About a week or two ago emojis stopped displaying on Pull Request Summary page and instead show the code of that particular emoji. However, they still display properly when navigated to the pull request page.

Maybe it's somewhat related to BCLOUD-14417 ?

h2. Summary page - No emojis
!2180507325-broken%20emoji.jpg|thumbnail!

h2. Pull request page - Emojis
!686990931-emojis%202.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Emojis stopped displaying in titles on pull request list page

fields.description:
Currently, if you have watched an object (issue, repository, etc) and reply to a notification via email, the comment will be added. However, there are no email notifications being sent to those who are watching that specific object.

*Steps to reproduce*:

# User A creates an issue tracker in a repository.
# User B then watches the issue tracker and the repository to receive notifications.
# User A adds a comment in the issue tracker
# User B receives an email notification that someone added a comment.
# User B then added a comment by replying via email
# Wait for 5-10mins. No email notification sent to User B. But the comment was added into the issue tracker.

* This also happens for comments in PR, and comments for commits.
** For commit's comments, when replying via email the comment is not even added to the commit.


h3. Expected Result
All users who have watched a specific object will receive an email notification when someone adds a comment via email.

h3. Actual Result
All users who have watched a specific object are not receiving an email notification when someone adds a comment via email.
fields.summary: Email Notification reply doesn't send another email notification.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

Create a public repository with user A\\
Open the public repository with a user B\\
Right click -> View Page Source -> Search for "rss" and open the link\\
The RSS feed won't be readable as it's going to tell, it requires READ access (regardless that the repository is public)\\
Once READ access is given for user B that account will be able to open the RSS feed
fields.summary: READ access is required to open the RSS feed on a public repository

fields.description: In a pull request, I can see a list of commits in that PR, I should be able to click those commits and see the code change for that particular commit.
fields.summary: Should be able to view code change by commits

fields.description:
See https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-Pipelines-questions/How-to-setup-Gradle-Remote-Build-Cache/qaq-p/981395?utm_source=atlcomm&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=immediate_general_answer&utm_content=topic

Bitbucket pipeline has a mechanism in place that allows to save and restore the Gradle cache directory. We work with larger projects (following the mono-repository) approach, where it approach may not scale too well. A Gradle cache grows rather quickly and it takes substantial resources already to just pack/unpack the Gradle cache. Moreover, different steps in the pipeline may only need small parts of it.

It would be desirable to have support for https://proandroiddev.com/speed-up-your-build-with-gradle-remote-build-cache-2ee9bfa4e18. As it allows to incrementelly check whether a given task has already been performed.

A simple HTTP repository would already  suffice for it. In other project we made use of Artifactory generic repositories for this purpose. Alternatively it would be interesting to have support for repositories in general, meaning generic HTTP, Docker and Maven similar to others like GitLab and Azure DevOps where it is a built-in feature as well.
fields.summary: Support Gradle Remote Build Cache

fields.description:
h2. Summary
The dashboard is not avialble for IE 11 while [Internet Explore|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/which-browsers-does-bitbucket-support-296092232.html] is supported.

h2. Environment
* Internet Explore Version 11.1.17134.0

h2. Steps to Reproduce
# Open https://bitbucket.org/ by IE 11

h2. Expected Results
The dashboard page should be available for all the supported browsers.

h2. Actual Results
The below exceptions are thrown in console:

* Syntax error for {{export class ...}} code
* Undefined error for {{Request}} object

!2045056741-Screenshot%202019-02-05%2015.40.41.png|thumbnail!\\
##Workaround

Use other browsers such as Chrome, Firefox, Safari or Microsoft Edge.\\
Most pages are still available such as https://bitbucket.org/account/ and https://bitbucket.org/{username}/{slug}/.
fields.summary: Dashboard is unavailable for IE 11

fields.description:
Commit page is making too many requests and dies with

bq. 429 (TOO MANY REQUESTS)


[Exclude files from the new pull request experience|https://bitbucket.org/blog/exclude-files-from-the-new-pull-request-experience]\\
is not working.

What exactly should be enabled in Bitbucket Labs is not clear. What is {{the new experience}}?\\
Hint on the {{excluded-files}} is useless, please add the exact name of the feature that shoud be enabled.

I enabled everything and it still does not work.

I don't need all this file comparison, I only go to commit view to press {{Deploy to AWS}} button.
fields.summary: Commit page is making too many requests

fields.description:
I have a personal bitbucket account, and a Team within in.

When I create a repo, I used to be able to associate the team groups to the group access permissions in the repo settings.

Now, the drop down is empty.  It's been like this for a few days now.

If I try to do this on a repo that is owner by the Team, groups work as expected there.

I created a group in my personal account to work around the new behavior and that works as expected.

Any projects where I already added the team group still have it, but it's not possible to delete and add it again.

I'm not sure if you removed the feature on purpose, so I am reporting this as a bug.

Also when I edited the name of a group, it did the action but failed to hide the window.  Attempting to save it again results in an unexpected error.   Please look into fixing that too.
fields.summary: Group feature behavior recently changed or is broken on bitbucket.com repo setting

fields.description: Installing an application with a post-install redirect into a team account will fail to redirect after installation, but will succeed when installed into a user account.
fields.summary: Post-Install Redirect for Applications Fails for Team Accounts

Editor changes characters by itself

Hi guys.

Currently I have only 3 users in a 5 user plan, however, the system is not allowing to add more user, as you can see on the attached file.

Can you help me?

Best,
fields.summary: Problem trying to add a new user

fields.description:
Currently, an issue comment is added only for the commit that includes a command for an issue (e.g., {{close BCLOUD-123}}).

But a commit message can refer the issue in another way - like this {{[#123] add a feature}}, and BitBucket web UI adds the link to that issue on the Commits list. It would be nice if an issue comment is added automatically for this case too.
fields.summary: Create an issue comment for a commit that includes the issue number.

fields.description:
When I include the issue number on the commit message, the message in the Commits list put a link to the issue, but in the Source file list, a link does not exist.

Can you put a link int the Source file list too?
fields.summary: Issue link does not work on the messages in the Source file list.

fields.description:
The function to merge branches in bitBucket does not work anymore. I will merge branch B to branch A and then I will receive a confirmation of the branches being merged, but when I do a diff between branch A and branch B, then they are different.

Step-by-step:

# Go to bitBucket repo > Branches > Select branch B.
# Change destination branch from master to branch A.
# Press Merge. Notice the confirmation message "Merged B  into A".
# Check for diff between branch B and A. They should be no diff, but in fact they are not the same.
fields.summary: Branch merging function in bitBucket does not work

fields.description:
*Issue:*   for HG repository that has a Jira Cloud integration, if the branch is created with exactly 40 characters long,  Bitbucket sees it as a SHA1 and this will cause issues and lead to errors when creating PR using Bitbucket UI

*Workaround:*    when creating a branch from Jira issue, users need to make sure the branch name is either More Than 40 characters or Less Than 40 characters,  but never = 40.\\
Then you will not run into issues with Pull requests and merges.

This only affects mercurial repositories with Jira Cloud integration when creating branches from Jira issue.
fields.summary: For HG repos with Jira integration - branch name cannot be 40 characters exactly

fields.description:
Scenario:\\
Commits A, B, C in master in close succession.\\
master set to auto-deploy to production using pipelines.

*Current behavior:*\\
While A is deploying, deploys for B and C are paused automatically.\\
B and C have to be manually unpaused after A is done.

*Desired behavior (perhaps optionally):*\\
While A is deploying, deploys for B and C are paused automatically.\\
When A is done, B automatically starts.\\
When B is done, C automatically starts.

Basically, I want the deploys to be queued. This is a typical continuous deployment scenario IME.
fields.summary: Option to auto-unpause next deploy

fields.description:
Similar to BCLOUD-16607, but only for some files on the wiki. With those files, going to the online editor and randomly deleting bits and clicking preview will show a rendered version. Clicking edit and then immediately preview again, without changing anything, and now it won't render.

The files render fine offline using docutils.

I've tried turning off the new source browser experience, and tried with different browsers, along with lots of refreshing.
fields.summary: RestructuredText files sometimes not rendering on wiki

fields.description:
Some customers are using LFS in the repository and they want to save space issues when frequently updating an existing LFS object/file.

Currently, what they're doing is to LFS prune their local copy of their repository.

However, for LFS remote, they will need to manually delete the updated object/file each time it was updated.

It's best if we can have an option for users to be able to prune their LFS remote so that there's no need for them to find then remove each file (in LFS) that was updated.
fields.summary: LFS prune on remote

fields.description:
This has happened 3rd time when the merging from a development branch to master branch is failing.

harshit_coco_new was created earlier from harshit_coco.
fields.summary: harshit_coco_new branch in not getting merged with master branch

fields.description:
When I try to add branch permission and I have more than 4 users in my team, I'm not able to choose other members than the first 4 person as the field is not scrollable:

!156590872-untitled1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Branch Permission is not scrollable

fields.description:
Hi,\\
I am not sure, if i am the only one, but when I am on the pverview on the Pipelines page it annoys me that i cant stop or continue the process by clicking just on the icons (not the link itself).

Greetings
fields.summary: Make the pipeline icon in "status" continue Pipeline

fields.description:
Ideally it would be nice if the _BitBucket_ workflow supported...

# Developer writes a block of code.
# Developer pushes commits to _BitBucket_
# Developer creates pull request (for the code to be reviewed & approved)
# Developer continues writing code for the same branch.
# Developer pushes commits to _BitBucket_
# Developer creates pull request (for the code to be reviewed & approved)
# Developer continues writing code for the same branch.

The advantage here:

# code reviews can be performed using a Pull Request on a regular basis\\
(A) thus allowing problems to be caught earlier in the development process\\
(B) thus making it easier to perform the code review (i.e. looking at 100 lines of code versus 1000)
# the _master_ branch is not updated until the feature is complete\\
(A) as a result, the code base is more likely to remain stable

Is there a way to accomplish this without...

# constantly pushing to master, or
# creating yet another branch?
fields.summary: Feature request: the ability to create multiple pull requests for the same branch (without merging)

fields.description:
Today on Bitbucket branches are alphabetically sorted instead of being sorted by latest used to last used.

The best approach is to sort the branch list from latest used to last used instead of alphabetically.
fields.summary: Sort branches by latest used instead of by name

fields.description: If a ticket has sub-tasks assigned to it, it would be extremely helpful to see when those tickets have an active pull request.  Currently there's an icon identifying each sub-task, the status of the task, and then the name of the person working on the task.  Simply adding an icon indicating which sub-tasks have PR's open would help us quickly process where each sub-task was.
fields.summary: Pull request icon on ticket sub-task

fields.description:
On this page: https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/overview there is a "Your Work" section for pull requests that you are part of.  If there are more than 3 reviewers some of the reviewers will be hidden behind a ... icon.  When I have multiple PRs going on it can be easy to forget which ones I have approved.   It then becomes a bit cumbersome to have to hit the icon on each PR to see my status.

My feature request is to always make the "Me" icon first in the list of reviewers.  That makes sure that it is always visible, and is trivial to scan down the list for what I need to review.
fields.summary: Always show my reviewer icon first in the Your Work overview

fields.description:
As per the title, if the Bitbucket Sidebar is collapsed, nothing seems to happen when clicking the "..." icon which hides important features such as the "settings" page.

This was reproducible on Chrome and Safari in the latest version of each browser, but was not reproducible on Firefox, also in the latest version.

See the image below for more details:\\
!2543868697-Screen%20Shot%202019-01-31%20at%2015.02.14.png|thumbnail!

As a workaround, you can expand the sidebar like this, which will show the hidden features.\\
!3799511757-Screen%20Shot%202019-01-31%20at%2015.04.12.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Bitbucket Sidebar does not allow to click on the hidden icons under the "..." icon when collapsed

fields.description:
When trying to add users to a repository, some users will not show up in the list although they have valid Bitbucket accounts.

h3. Steps to reproduce
h1. Go to https://bitbucket.org/<username>/<reponame>/admin/access.\\
h2. In the user field, start typing a username or email address.

h3. Expected result
The username you're looking for will show up in a list so it can be selected.

h3. Current results
Some users that have been verified to have a Bitbucket Cloud account don't appear on that list. However, if you type the whole username and press enter, the user will be added to your repository.
fields.summary: Users

fields.description:
!3973231409-Screen%20Shot%202019-01-30%20at%208.55.17%20AM.png|thumbnail!

Hello,

I am on a 13 inch Macbook Pro (2560 x 1600).

On a repository overview page, I cannot see droplistContent under the Show More menu ie "..."

The README covers the droplistContent menu. It is like this on Repository Overview, Source, Branches, Pipelines, and Deployments.

The current work around is to go to another page like Pull Requests in order to access this menu. I've recreated this on Chrome, Chrome Incognito, and Firefox.

!1600041639-Screen%20Shot%202019-01-31%20at%201.23.44%20AM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: UI/UX "Show more" droplistContent now showing displaying over PageContent

fields.description:
Good day.

I'm sorry if this is not the correct place where should I submit this issue.

I am deploying AWS ECS using bitbucket pipeline through atlassian/pipelines-awscli image with AWS Systems Manager Parameter Store configurations. You may refer to this [documentation|https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonECS/latest/developerguide/specifying-sensitive-data.html] for complete details.

Upon registering task definition an error occured:

Parameter validation failed:\\
Unknown parameter in containerDefinitions[0]: "secrets", must be one of: name, image, repositoryCredentials, cpu, memory, memoryReservation, links, portMappings, essential, entryPoint, command, environment, mountPoints, volumesFrom, linuxParameters, hostname, user, workingDirectory, disableNetworking, privileged, readonlyRootFilesystem, dnsServers, dnsSearchDomains, extraHosts, dockerSecurityOptions, interactive, pseudoTerminal, dockerLabels, ulimits, logConfiguration, healthCheck, systemControls

The parameter "secrets" should be accepted based on the documentation. Is atlassian/pipelines-awscli image outdated?. If it is, kindly update it to the latest AWS CLI version.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Parameter validation failed: Unknown parameter in containerDefinitions[0]: "secrets" on atlassian/pipelines-awscli:latest image

fields.description:
When the branch name contains a slash ( / ), and that branch name is chosen in the "New schedule" window, when I try to schedule PIpelines, I can't choose the "Pipeline" as it's greyed out:

!3802737323-image-2019-01-30-14-07-24-058.png|thumbnail!

When the branch name doesn't contain a slash, it's not greyed out and it's choosable:

!3380105738-image-2019-01-30-14-07-59-595.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: PIpeline's Schedule doesn't work when the branch name contains slash ( / )

fields.description: Currently with Markdown, you can set Numbered Lists. It would be useful if we could have a feature to set Numbered Headings. The headings would then be numbered automatically.
fields.summary: Ability to set numbered headings with Markdown in Wiki

fields.description:
Personally, I found it very confusing that the tests tab only shows up if there are any failures.

https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/test-reporting-in-pipelines-939708543.html

In addition to that, the tooltip on the "plus" makes it sound like I've set up something wrong in my pipeline, when in reality everything is just fine. pipelines found my tests, parsed them and identified zero failures.
fields.summary: Don't show the "Quickly access test results" call-to-action if a pipeline is already configured to upload test results.

fields.description:
Error occured while creating new pull request

7eb339f74f874c9695dc18de8c73fc8e

Something went wrong\\
While we check things on our end, refresh the page and contact support if the problem persists.

When contacting support, provide them with this code:

22e3f01a05be4891bb5a8bc29de71d7d

Our status page may also provide additional details.
fields.summary: Unable to create pull request on forked branch

fields.description:
Go to any repository, click: Settings > User and group access

The dropdown where you can give access to a team is not populating at all making it impossible to give access to teams.
fields.summary: Select a group dropdown empty when trying to give group/team access

fields.description:
As per: https://getsupport.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/11/BBS-89341

We had an issue that was caused by a change made in pipelines:\\
*Our team had enabled a security feature on the docker daemons to isolate containers with a user namespace.\\
This update may have affected the build that you're experiencing now.\\
For more info about the update: https://docs.docker.com/engine/security/userns-remap/

We're currently working on a documentation that will guide you and your team to fix the build.\\
Once the documentation is ready, we will update it on our infrastructure page and send an email to account's administrators.

Infrastructure changes in Bitbucket Pipelines

Once the update is out, you and your team will have a few weeks to make the changes before we enable the feature on your account.*

We are still waiting for the documentation to be updated here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/infrastructure-changes-in-bitbucket-pipelines-872135046.html

Please advise when this will be done
fields.summary: Documentation regarding the change to isolate containers with a user namespace

fields.description:
GET's for pull requests on Bitbucket in the cloud are all very slow in South Africa (confirmed with a colleague in another location), or they fail with a 404.

404: https://bqlf8qjztdtr.statuspage.io/api/v1/incidents/unresolved.json

Never responded:

* https://bitbucket.org/!api/1.0/repositories/<redacted>/projectx/pullrequests/108/updates?since=2019-01-30T15%3A30%3A04.293955
* https://bitbucket.org/!api/1.0/repositories/<redacted>/projectx/pullrequests/108/participants?avatar_size=64
* https://bitbucket.org/<redacted>/projectx/pull-requests/108/feature-rewards-and-rebates/diff?_pjax=%23pr-tab-content
* https://bitbucket.org/account/xhr/header_information/?_=<redacted>
* https://bitbucket.org/!api/1.0/repositories/<redacted>/projectx/pullrequests/108/updates?since=2019-01-30T15%3A30%3A04.293955
fields.summary: Pull requests on bitbucket cloud is unusable (slow/404)

fields.description: GET's for pull requests on Bitbucket in the cloud are all very very slow in South Africa (confirmed with a colleague in another location), or they fail with a 404.
fields.summary: Pull requests on bitbucket cloud is unusable (slow/404)

fields.description:
The pipelines validator seems to have started to parse yaml inside quotes.

I can't remember precisely testing this few months ago, but there are some vague memories that it didn't do that.

See attached screenshot.

One would need to use the colon ":" in a variable to be able to use it in strings (that's my only solution for now, since i really need to create this pipeline)

----
Update: see comment
fields.summary: Pipelines validator parses YAML  inside quotes

fields.description:
Allow to have snippets that lives within the project (and therefore are available only to this project members).

This is very useful when you want to share some code with members of this project but don't want to pollute the global snippet space.
fields.summary: Allow per project snippets

fields.description:
For no apparent reason, since this morning, our pytest-flake8 plugin started throwing this exception for every file that was being checked:

{code}
#!python

/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/pluggy/hooks.py:284: in __call__
    return self._hookexec(self, self.get_hookimpls(), kwargs)
/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/pluggy/manager.py:68: in _hookexec
    return self._inner_hookexec(hook, methods, kwargs)
/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/pluggy/manager.py:62: in <lambda>
    firstresult=hook.spec.opts.get("firstresult") if hook.spec else False,
/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/_pytest/runner.py:111: in pytest_runtest_call
    item.runtest()
/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/pytest_flake8.py:117: in runtest
    self.statistics)
/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/py/_io/capture.py:150: in call
    res = func(*args, **kwargs)
/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/pytest_flake8.py:190: in check_file
    app.make_notifier()
E   AttributeError: 'Application' object has no attribute 'make_notifier'

{code}

Same tests pass fine locally... Could it be something changed with volume sharing on the CI env containers?

https://bitbucket.org/rebelp/gigcomply/addon/pipelines/home#!/results/5038/steps/%7B10756fab-b7bf-47f7-9b29-bae3b24034f5%7D
fields.summary: Tests have started failing since yesterday

fields.description:
Dear Bitbucket Developer,

I got stuck when forking a repo. The url is https://bitbucket.org/zxluo/handlers_averagecamera, would you please help to resolve this issue?

Thank you very much.
fields.summary: Stuck on "Please wait a moment while we clone your repository."

fields.description:
git lfs fetch has been failing on specific files after fresh clone.

It is failing consistently on specific files so as an experiment I {{git rm}}ed the failing files, but now it's failing on a different file. There's already an  [issue open with git-lfs|https://github.com/git-lfs/git-lfs/issues/3494], but this feels like an LFS server issue (the first three comments on the issue mention that they use bitbucket).

Concretely,

{{$ GIT_LFS_SKIP_SMUDGE=1 git clone git@bitbucket.org:<repo>.git}} succeeds

but\\
{{git lfs fetch}} fails with

{code}
$ git lfs fetch
fetch: Fetching reference refs/heads/master
2019/01/30 09:27:46 Unsolicited response received on idle HTTP channel starting with "<part-of-file>"; err=<nil>
Downloading LFS objects:  36% (1198/3313), 1.7 GB | 4.6 MB/s   Expected OID <some-hash>, got <other-hash> after 83429376 bytes written                                     
error: failed to fetch some objects from 'https://bitbucket.org/<repo>.git/info/lfs'
{code}

Rerunning with GIT_TRACE produces

{code}
#!log
$ GIT_TRACE=1 git lfs fetch
09:40:57.915993 trace git-lfs: exec: git '-c' 'filter.lfs.smudge=' '-c' 'filter.lfs.clean=' '-c' 'filter.lfs.process=' '-c' 'filter.lfs.required=false' 'rev-parse' 'HEAD' '--symbolic-full-name' 'HEAD'             
09:40:57.917093 trace git-lfs: tq: running as batched queue, batch size of 100
09:40:57.917103 trace git-lfs: fetch <file-name> [<id>]
09:40:57.917124 trace git-lfs: tq: sending batch of size 1
09:40:57.917166 trace git-lfs: run_command: ssh -- git@bitbucket.org git-lfs-authenticate <repo> download
09:40:59.010400 trace git-lfs: api: batch 1 files
09:40:59.010777 trace git-lfs: HTTP: POST https://bitbucket.org/.../.../info/lfs/objects/batch
09:40:59.404101 trace git-lfs: HTTP: 200
09:40:59.404185 trace git-lfs: HTTP: {"objects": [{"oid": "<id>", "actions": {"download": {"header": {"X-Client-ID": "<hash-A>", "Authorization": "Bearer <hash-B>"}, "href": "ht
09:40:59.404287 trace git-lfs: HTTP: tps://api.media.atlassian.com/file/<hash-C>/binary"}}, "size": 83429376}]}
09:40:59.404469 trace git-lfs: tq: starting transfer adapter "basic"
09:40:59.629873 trace git-lfs: xfer: Attempting to resume download of "<id>" from byte 83429376                                                          
09:40:59.630036 trace git-lfs: HTTP: GET https://api.media.atlassian.com/file/<hash-C>/binary
09:41:00.239427 trace git-lfs: HTTP: 400
09:41:00.239605 trace git-lfs: HTTP: {"error":{"code":"InvalidArgumentError","title":"range first index must not be greater than last index","href":"https://api.media.atlassian.com#InvalidArgumentError"}}
09:41:00.239809 trace git-lfs: tq: retrying object <id>: LFS: Client error: https://api.media.atlassian.com/file/<hash-C>/binary
{code}
fields.summary: git lfs fetch fails with InvalidArgumentError

fields.description: As a user, we want to allow 2FA for Git / Hg transactions as well as UI logins.
fields.summary: Allow 2FA for Git / Hg transactions

fields.description: I have lost access to a repository CommonDevPhase1.1, I would like to know if there is any way to reset the permissions, I have an administrator level account.
fields.summary: I have lost access to a repository, I would like to know if there is any way to reset the permissions, I have an administrator level account.

fields.description:
Currently, this IP's list (https://ip-ranges.atlassian.com) is only showing Atlassian "owned" IP addresses.\\
The IPv6 range "2406:da00:ff00::0/96*" is not listed there because it's not owned by Atlassian.\\
https://bitbucket.org/blog/new-ip-addresses-bitbucket-cloud

However, it would be best if we can have a single list (in JSON file format) of Bitbucket.org IP addresses that Atlassian's owned or not.

*Benefits*:\\
This is for automation purposes for other users.
fields.summary: List of Bitbucket Cloud IP addresses in a single JSON file

fields.description:
Hi,

Looks like my repository got stuck during import and I am not able to delete it either since it is not showing up the settings option for the repo. Could you please delete it.

https://bitbucket.org/repo/import/1798217

thanks,\\
-vishwas.
fields.summary: Repository stuck on import, cannot delete
Pipelines Build Teardown unexpected operator error

fields.description:
Currently, BitBucket only supports to add  ed25519 SSH key to user account, not Pipeline.\\
This is needed to help a deployment tool (like Ansible) running in Pipeline access to server (via SSH).
fields.summary: Support ed25519 SSH key in Pipeline

fields.description: When a user copies code from the diff view, it includes the + / - characters. It'd be nice to provide a quick copy to the clipboard, removing any unnecessary characters -- just the code!
fields.summary: Omit '+ / -' from diff when copying

fields.description:
I have a pipeline which compile and deploy my project on a specific environment. And sometimes, but not every time, some additional step need to be performed (like, for example wiping the database and restore it to a specific status)

Currently, I do that using manually triggered steps. but it's time consuming, and I cannot "Fire and forget" when I commit.

Another advantage of the commit message solutions is that the deactivated steps could be marked as such, and so the whole job could be marked as fully successful. Currently I have a big chump of job which are marked as successfull but not finished, because I never ran the  additional jobs.

A workaround could be to provide the commit message through and environment variable. Up to us to check if the commit contains the information we need (or not).
fields.summary: Add a way to deactivate specific step when the commit message contains a specific string

fields.description: When deleting a task in a pull request, it still appears in the open tasks list.
fields.summary: Pull request task is not fully deleted

fields.description:
Currently, there are sites that will allow 2FA / TOTP without having to add SSH keys for authentication. For Bitbucket, we'd need to expand this using SMS.

For now we only allow normal 2FA or FIDO U2F with use of SSH keys.
fields.summary: Add 2FA without SSH keys

fields.description: In specific instances, it seems some administrators are unable to add colleagues to their team by just a username on a repository. If they know their e-mail address, and they're added to the team, then they can be added by username on subsequent repository additions.
fields.summary: Unable to add users by username

fields.description:
Like in many other sites/tools, it would be a great addition to be able to flag a repository as being inactive/closed.

No one wants to throw away code, but sometimes products/libraries get out-of-maintenance or end-of-life.

By the years, the list of repositories grows and grows and while it's possible to put them in a project, there might even be repositories inside a larger project that become inactive.

Just to hide them from view, let us make them inactive (does read-only already exist? not sure tbh). If not, this would be great, too.

There's plenty room left in the search bar, so "status: active/inactive" could be added easily.

Thanks for reading!\\
Cheers, mike
fields.summary: Flag repos as being "inactive" to reduce list size (Bitbucket Web Client)

fields.description: It looks like https://bitbucket.org/mschipperheyn/funcional-web is stuck in forking.
fields.summary: Repository stuck in forking

fields.description: The syntax highlight does not work for the Dart language while the _New source browser experience_ is active. Disabling this beta feature resolves the issue.
fields.summary: Syntax highlight not working for Dart on new source browser

fields.description:
We dropped support of Test environment; left only Staging & Production. Still Test is visible on Deployments page and looks confusing.

I expected it to vanish after I merge new pipelines config into master, but it did not happen. Is there a way to hide it?
fields.summary: Can I hide Test environment from Deployments?

fields.description:
It would by very useful, if the search component support to search by project.

There a two use cases:

* Search a project by term.
* Search a repository by project name.
fields.summary: Support search by projects

fields.description:
Hello,

it seems that using find function (cntl + F) hides the 3 last code lines. The problem occurs when there are many code lines

See attachments.

Regards
fields.summary: CSS : find function hides 3 last lines of code

fields.description:
Hi,

Really love the new pull request default description. Nice work Atlassian team, but I won't be using it.

What I'd like to see is a default title on pull requests.

The title gets put into merge comments, and with 30+ repositories for the one project, it'd make it much easier to differentiate them if the developers followed the title conventions we have in place.

It would also be nice to have some variables such as 'from branch' added to the defaults.
fields.summary: As a repository admin, I want to set a default pull request title

fields.description:
We would like to use a self signed certificate in our pipeline. In gitlab there is a mechanism to set parameters to docker service like this:

services:

* name: docker:dind\\
command: ["--insecure-registry=fqdn_of_the_private_registry:port"]

would you create something like this in bitbucket's pipeline?

thank you\\
Zoltan Zidarics\\
Innobyte Ltd.\\
Budapest, Hungary\\
zidarics.zoltan@innobyte.hu
fields.summary: Accepting self signed certificates in pipeline to create docker image

fields.description:
We are running a project for a CakePHP app, and we have the PHPUnit tests running within pipelines for every commit. I recently increased the testing commands to not just test Components and Models but to also expand to Controllers and other utils.

Since doing so, the tests often past, but they also sometimes fail.  When they fail, it seems that the tests suddenly stop running without any visible or perceived error.

When the tests complete, the build eventually passes.

Here's a sample of the output when the Cake tests run:

{code}
+ ./Console/cake test app All
Welcome to CakePHP v2.10.15 Console
---------------------------------------------------------------
App : myapp
Path: /opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/build/app/
---------------------------------------------------------------
CakePHP Test Shell
---------------------------------------------------------------
PHPUnit 5.7.27 by Sebastian Bergmann and contributors.
..................................S........S..........
...
Build teardown
{code}

As you can see, no errors.  Could this be a timeout issue?\\
We rely heavily on Pipelines for our development process. Any insight would be great, thank you!
fields.summary: Pipeline Aborts Testing and Fails With No reason

fields.description: git push to my repositories is giving me a consistent "ssh: connect to host bitbucket.org port 22: No route to host" right now.
fields.summary: No route to host
